author: MSNBC.com
title: New poll shows Biden with wide lead among black voters
description: A new poll from The Washington Post and Ipsos aimed at Democratic-leaning black voters shows former Vice President Joe Biden with a significant lead over other candidates, with 48% of black voters expressing a preference for him as a candidate. Senator Bernie…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Lee: Trump is selling our soldiers as mercenaries, he 'does not deserve to be the commander in chief'
description: Rep. Barbara Lee joins Joy Reid to discuss President Donald Trump's recent interview with Laura Ingraham where the president boasted about sending troops to Saudi Arabia in exchange for "$1 billion in the bank."
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Foreign policy analyst: United States only cares 'about human rights violations when the enemy commits them'
description: Rula Jebreal, foreign policy analyst and visiting professor at the University of Miami, joins Joy Reid to discuss the Trump administration's recent actions in Iran and how it pertains to other nations in the Middle East, such as Saudi Arabia.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Black police officers in South Bend say Buttigieg never addressed racial issues when he was mayor
description: The Root's Michael Harriot discusses his reporting on the South Bend police department, where black police officers say complaints about racial issues were not addressed under Pete Buttigieg.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘Art of the Deal’ co-author: Everyone feels the ‘contagious’ anxiety Trump spreads
description: Tony Schwartz, co-author of Pres. Trump's 1987 book 'Art of the Deal',joins Joy Reid to discuss a poll from the American Psychiatry Association that Americans are more anxious this year. Schwartz says that Pres. Trump's anxiety is "contagious" and is felt by …
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Warren ‘disappointed’ Sanders is trashing her on campaign trail
description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren has been taking some attacks from fellow Sen. Bernie Sanders’ campaign. Warren said she is “disappointed” he is “sending volunteers out to trash me” on the campaign trail.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 4 Iraqi soldiers injured, no US injuries after 8 rockets hit Iraqi air base
description:
8 rockets hit Iraq's Balad Air Base, Iraqi military spokesperson tells NBC News. 4 Iraqi soldiers were injured. No US soldiers were injured or killed in the attack.

NBC's Chief Foreign Correspondent Richard Engel joins Alex Witt to discuss the situation so f…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'We have confidence in our case': Pelosi says House Dems will vote on delivering of impeachment articles
description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi made a rare appearance on the Sunday talk shows and said that her caucus would be voting this week on whether or nto send
content: Pelosi says no regrets about holding onto impeachment articles, suggests Trump could face more
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Esper says he ‘didn’t see’ proof backing Trump’s claim that Iran was preparing to strike 4 embassies
description: Defense Secretary Mark Esper says he "didn't see" specific evidence that Iran was readying to attack 4 US embassies, as President Donald Trump claimed last week, though Esper says he shares Trump's view that such an attack was "probably" in the works.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Disgraced former Nissan CEO flees Japan, vows to clear his name
description:
Former Nissan CEO Carlos Ghosn fled to Lebanon last Monday from Japan where he was out on bail and awaiting trial on charges of financial misconduct, including the concealment of millions in income.

Ghosn, speaking publicly for the first time since fleeing J…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Cardin: 'The United States has been isolated from our allies'
description: Sen. Ben Cardin joins Alex Witt to discuss tensions with Iran and says that the U.S. has been isolated from its allies when it comes to foreign policy.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Thousands protest in Iran after government admits it shot down passenger plane
description:
Protestors gathered in Iran for the second straight day, chanting "down with the regime", after the government reversed course and admitting it shot down a passenger plane, killing all 176 people aboard. 

Cal Perry breaks down the situation, including Pres. …

author: MSNBC.com
title: Who won the week? Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's for their decision to step back from roles with royal family
description: On this week's 'Who Won the Week,' Joy forgoes the panel and selects Prince Harry and Meghan Markle for their decision to step back from their senior roles as members of the British royal family.
